SENT.plain: Cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMRI) has emerged as a useful tertiary imaging tool in the investigation of patients suspected of many different types of cardiomyopathies
CMRI sequences are now of a sufficiently robust quality to enable high spatial and temporal resolution image acquisition
This has led to CMRI becoming an effective non-invasive imaging gold standard for many cardiomyopathies
In this 2-part review, we outline the typical sequences used to image cardiomyopathy, and present the imaging spectrum of cardiomyopathy
Part 1 focuses on the current classification of cardiomyopathy, basic CMRI sequences used in evaluating cardiomyopathy and the imaging spectrum of common phenotypes
